page.title: 01RYDE: REGIONAL BREAKDOWN
page.content: This area can be considered in five regions: 1) The N.W side of the area comprising the{residential outskirts}of the seaside resort and ferry port of{Ryde. 2) The{coastal strip}extending 2 km to the east of Ryde. This, once a select area of gentlemen's estates with parkland, is now dominated by{tourist {and public amenity development.} 3) The east and southerly continuation of the coastal strip. This is a{ {"desirable residental area"}based around the select Victorian seaside village of {Seaview.} 4) The inland area including the rural, linear village of{Nettlestone and surrounding{farmland.} 5) In the S.E., on the site of a disused airfield, is an {out-of-town {amenity area.}
